result.execSummary:
The defendant Sammie Lavon Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sammie Lavon Owens

records.addlTxt:
AND PLEA/SENTENCING 9:16 AM Defendant Sammie Lavon Owens in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Sammie Lavon Owens.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes amended information for Count 1 to misdemeanor. Attorney Anderson waives reading to amended information. Defendant to plead to sole count. For sole count, 180 days imposed and stayed for 12 months probation. Conditions of probation include pay a $100 fine plus costs and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC. State in agreement. Defendant pleads guilty. Attorney Anderson stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for sole count, 180 days imposed and stayed for 12 months probation. Conditions of probation include pay a $100 fine plus costs and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC.

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM 
Exhibit 1 marked before hearing. 
Defendant Sammie Lavon Owens in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Sammie Lavon Owens.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Officer Finkbeiner - Officer Finkbeiner sworn and testifies.
Responded to assault at Shutlz Bar and discovered altercation where one patron was knocked out. Patron was identified in ID key as victim 1. Victim said he had pain to his jaw. Witness stated a male had sucker punched victim 1 in the face and that he was knocked out for not more than a couple minutes, unconscious. Bartender stated the person was named Sam but wasn't sure of last name. Owner gave officer Sammie Owens name after viewing surveillance video. Officer Davis downloaded the surveillance video. Used DL photo to ID person in video. 
Atty Anderson objects.
State offers Exhibit 1 - 2  video clips and photo. Atty Anderson has not seen them. State plays photo and video clips on monitor and Officer testifies to them. State offers Exhibit 1 - No response from Atty Anderson. Exhibit 1 received. 
Officer ID's Dfd in courtroom. State asks record to identify, no response from Atty Anderson. Court finds ID. 
Atty Anderson cross exam Officer.
Officer Cullens spoke with the bartender and she didn't see the incident. Contacted state of MN to get photo of Dfd. 
No more witnesses for state.
No witnesses for Defense. 
State asks for bind over.
Atty Anderson opposes bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. 
Set ARG.
Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sammie Lavon Owens
Current: 1202 Harrison St, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2022)
Prior: 4915 Norwood St, Duluth, MN 55804

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim 1. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol.

1:38 PM Defendant Sammie Lavon Owens in court.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Address verified 1202 Harrison Street, Superior, 54880.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney.  State requests $2500 signature bond, with condition of no contact with Victim 1, no frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve alcohol.  Cites prior history, mostly in Minnesota with FTA's. 
Defendant has no response.
Court orders 2500 signature bond, with conditions of no contact with Victim 1 and no frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. 
Defendant will retain Fritz Anderson as counsel. Waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntarily made
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
